prs.title: Data Streams: Remove Data Streams code from the core node repo
prs.truncated_body:
All Data Streams code has been moved to the [data-streams-deploy](https://github.com/smartcontractkit/data-streams-deploy) repo.

We will keep here the one file which is used by CLD's core. We don't want to move it to `data-streams-deploy` because we need it in a public repo. We also don't want to move it to CLD's repo because we want to avoid the complexity of a circular dependency.

prs.title: feat: add tonKey graphql query to support TON in Operator UI
prs.truncated_body: This PR adds tonKeys support to the GraphQL schema in the Core Node. JIRA: https://smartcontract-it.atlassian.net/browse/NONEVM-1866

prs.title: feat(op-acceptance-tests); base; geth-reth divergence test.
prs.truncated_body: **Description** Adds a new acceptance test which checks for divergence between geth and reth nodes by comparing their state roots. **Tests** Ran locally against kurtosis-based isthmus and interop devnets: **isthmus** **interop**

commits.message:
feat(op-acceptance-tests); base; geth-reth divergence test.

Adds a new acceptance test which checks for divergence between geth and reth nodes by comparing their state roots.
consolidated root divergence check into existing chain test.

Update devnet-sdk/testing/systest/multi_client.go

Addresses the bug of returning nil error upon hash != primaryHash && primaryHeader == nil and adds some more readability.

Co-authored-by: Yashvardhan Kukreja <yashvardhan@oplabs.co>

simplify handling of block hash mismatch case

log out all of the information we have
tweak godoc to remove reference to state root

Merge pull request #16047 from ethereum-optimism/gk/gethreth

simplify handling of block hash mismatch case
Clean up devnet-sdk fork detection logic

Merge pull request #16069 from ethereum-optimism/teddyknox/clean-up-multi-client

Clean up devnet-sdk multiclient fork detection

prs.title: op-node: Add RPC api to retrieve the current dependency set config
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

Adds an RPC API to op-node to return the dependency set config if one is set.  This is a parallel to the `optimism_rollupConfig` API.

RollupClient has been updated to support calling it.

**Metadata**

#16041  - required in order for the test-sequencer to fetch the full config.

commits.message: op-node: Add RPC api to retrieve the current dependency set config.

prs.title: op-acceptance-tests: interop: misc improvements to load test
prs.truncated_body:
- Properly protect the `rand.Source` in initiators
- Spam initiating messages in parallel
- Retry submission forever for valid messages

prs.title: feat: weaken timestamp restriction in `_ensureBatchConsistentWithL2Block`
prs.truncated_body:
## What ❔

Given that l2 blocks can now have same timestamps, it doesn't make any sense to require the timestamp of the batch to be greater than the timestamp of the last L2 block. Change to only require `new_batch.timestamp >= prev_block.timestamp` 

## Why ❔

See above

## Checklist

<!-- Check your PR fulfills the following items. -->
<!-- For draft PRs check the boxes as you complet

prs.title: fix: configure default timeout for blob clients
prs.truncated_body:
## 1. Purpose or design rationale of this PR

Avoid issues where the client hangs indefinitely, blocking follower node sync.


## 2. PR title

Your PR title must follow [conventional commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/#summary) (as we are doing squash merge for each PR), so it must start with one of the following [types](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/22b96b9/CO

commits.message: feat: configure default timeout for blob clients

prs.title: Witness Prefetching on Block Production
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

This changes aims to introduce Witness Prefetching right on producer nodes, reducing latency for stateless nodes and full nodes syncing via witness. In order to reach that we started pushing the witness on the `Seal` phase of consensus (something similar of what we already do in `FinalizeAndAssemble`). 

# Changes

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change that solves an issue)
- [ ]

prs.title: refactor(shred,storei): remove storei, replace dcache w/ wksp obj
prs.truncated_body:
This PR removes the `storei` tile from the firedancer topo.

Significantly, this requires replacing the `shred_store` dcache in the `shred` tile which houses the FEC sets. This was replaced with a new shared wksp object `fec_sets`. This conveniently allows `shred` and `repair` tiles to join the same shmem region, so repair can directly observe which FEC sets need repair (and request repairs for

commits.message: refactor(shred,storei): remove storei, replace dcache w/ wksp obj

prs.title: Improve error handling and logging for transaction simulation failures
prs.truncated_body:
This PR improves error handling and logging when transactions fail during simulation, making it easier for developers to debug transaction issues.

### Problem

When transactions fail during simulation, users encounter several issues:

1. **Cryptic error messages during compute unit estimation:**
   ```
   SolanaError: Transaction failed when it was simulated in order to estimate the compu

prs.title: Exclude CONFIG_SETTING from getledgerentry test
prs.truncated_body: This fixes a small flaky test that is currently breaking CI: it fails periodically (when the RNG seed is on specific values) because it generates a CONFIG_SETTING as a test LE that the test wants to be "new" and not-exist in the database it's serving, whereas most CONFIG_SETTINGs _do_ exist in the database, just by nature of .. being config settings. So generating a "new" one collides, it's not ne

prs.title: Feat: handle burn reorgs during tenure extends
prs.truncated_body:
This PR add an end to end integration test for a burn reorg which invalidates a tenure extend's burn view (but not the tenure's election burn block), and updates the endpoints and logics used to mine and validate block proposals impacted by such reorgs.

This PR:
* Updates signer logic to check the stacks-node's tenure info after local state times out (do not consult local state for global acce

commits.message:
feat: handle burn reorgs during tenure extends

* update signer logic to check node's tenure info after local state times out (do not consult local state for global acceptance status)
* update node get_tenuretip endpoint to return highest tip in tenure with canonical burn_view
* update proposal validation and mining logic to do the same
* update miner to be more defensive with burn_view check
chore: fix clippy warns, index creation error in CI
test: add e2e test for burn reorgs with split
chore: remove some test flake, cleanup db migrations

fix: signer_coordinator highest block check logic

if the highest block in their tenure is the block the coordinator is waiting on signatures for, just return Ok

prs.title: chore: depend on clarity backing store interface
prs.truncated_body:
### Description

The `ClarityTransactionConnection` currently depends on `WritableMarfStore`, which is an implementation of the `ClarityBackingStore` interface. This PR updates the dependency to reference the interface itself, rather than a specific implementation. This change enables third-party extensions to implement and use custom `ClarityBackingStore` implementations when creating `ClarityT

prs.title: go/client-sdk/core: Add round parameter to MinGasPrice
prs.truncated_body:
The Go client method `MinGasPrice` did not accept a round parameter and always queried the latest round.

Querying `MinGasPrice` for past rounds is necessary to calculate the charged fee for EVM EIP-1559 transactions, where the effective gas price depends on the base fee at the round of transaction (which corresponds to the min gas price in our case).

commits.message: go/client-sdk/core: Add round parameter to MinGasPrice

prs.title: Disallow slow sorting
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged

`sort.Slice` is an old method of sorting that relies on reflection. The `slices.Sort` method is generic and runs faster.

## How this works

This doesn't disallow `sort` entirely, as there are still some usages of the `sort.Interface` which are a bit more complex to change... Although we should probably change those as well eventually.

## How this was tested

prs.title: make GOPROXY overridable in constants.sh
prs.truncated_body:
## Why this should be merged
The default GOPROXY https://proxy.golang.org is not usable in China since the site has been blocked by GW firewall. It's a well-known issue in Chain and we use other mirrors to download go packages. So I add an extra parameter to build.sh to set an overriding GOPROXY for that.

## How this works
An extra parameter can be passed into build.sh, like:
```

prs.title: chore: Fix flaky tests
prs.truncated_body:
Fixes the flaky tests related to `INSUFFICIENT_TX_FEE`. 

Currently when any of the keys signing are having same short prefixes, we will be verifying extra signatures and are charging extra fee. This can easily happen with the Update tests and Schedule sign tests. 

To stabilize the tests, full prefix signatures are used in those tests.

fix more flaky tests

prs.title: chore: Logging improvements
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

This PR updates the logging configuration for Otter tests running on Turtle:

- The console shows only messages that do not come from a node.
- The file `turtle/otter.log` also contains all messages that do not come from a specific node.
- We create a `swirlds.log` file in each node's folder containing all log statements except those marked with `STATE_HASH`.
We create ano

prs.title: feat: remove shard/realm negative check in asTokenId
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:
when converting a possible long zero token address into a token Id, remove the check for negative values as this used to not throw an exception when the address is a non-long zero EVM address

**Checklist**

- [ ] Tested (unit, integration, etc.)
